rComments: Neil is a great lecturer but his tests are extremely difficult. As this is a course required for a lot of people, I would AVOID taking it with him if I had the chance. If you do take it with him, attend every lecture. Textbook questions will NOT prepare you for his tests!
teacherRatingTags: ['Test heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: Great professor, really puts his students in a situation where they can succeed. He gives clear lectures, lecture slides before class, and is open to questions. He is available almost all the time, and he takes time out of his day to help you. His class is by no means easy, you still have to do the work. But if you work hard, you'll get an A.

Teaches some materials beyond the book which really helps to get a better understanding of concept.  Tests are fair, love his test questions. Really good questions that tests on the concept except might be a little bit harder than expected.

Great Prof I've ever met, makes everything easier and more clear. The course is more about theory and proves of statsitics, so the course itself and test are not easy. Takes time to read through the lecture notes and textbook and also solve the textbook questions.
I could not follow what he talked and the lectures were really boring.

The lectures basically have no relationship with our test. In my opinion he is trying to make easy materials much more difficult to understand. I went to his classes no more than 5 times and decided to learn by myself. Take time to do the textbook  problems and past tests is a much better way to get good grades.

worst prof ever. He has no idea what he is doing, making mistake on slides every single class. He teaches stas 257 as teaching history , just read slides and theory, no practical examples. And he is not able to answer questions during the lecture. exam questions has never raleted to his lecture, and so much harder because he only do theory.

He is trying to teach a math course by reading off lecture slides. He also doesn't really follow the book, so like how are we supposed to know what's going on. You basically have to rely on past midterms.

EASSSIESTTT 70 you can get with minimal effort.Best prof along with Tim chan. even though i didn't attend class.Just do past tests and you should be able to get a high mark without any fuss. Really is the easiest course in 2nd yr with Neil (actually java is easier but not for everyone as they dont have prior java knowledge).

Awesome Prof! He tries hard to make his class interesting and succeeds overwhelmingly. Highly regards and emphasizes practicality of the course and real-life, correct application of it. Very straightforward instructions and material for assignments and exams. Great course!

One of the best profs at UofT. This guy knows what is important and doesn't believe in teaching long theoretical proofs for a practical course like Statistics. He lays great emphasis in checking model assumptions (one of the few profs who does this). Piece of advise: DO NOT miss his class. He is super funny.

Best professor EVER. I love his jokes. his jokes are damn UNIQUE and family guys jokes:)) ahahah I definitely love him like i do 60ish on all courses except on his coure which I got 80, he mae me come to classes just for his jokes and I enjoyed the materials
He is an amazing professor. Very fun. Makes statistics interesting !

never replied  my email. came to class late OFTEN. bluh-ed for straight 2 hours without giving a break. released the assignment marks after more than ONE MONTH of the due date!!! gave out two assignments at the same time with the same due date!!
No Comments

He's an ass.  He jokes around WAY too much in class and basically treats the material in such an off-hand manner that it's hard to grasp anything.  He's also not very approachable... he seems to have this holier-than-though attitude.
Makes too many jokes in class, better do the questions or get killed on the exam.
This guy is hot! hot! hot!  Very distracting in class.  Smart and supernice.

He's a fun prof and he's easy to look at.  He jokes around a lot.  His notes are clear, but here's a warning:  Do the assigned problem sets and go to your tutorials or you're going to get killed in the exam.

He is funny in STA250, but once you take 255 you find it hard to laugh. Tests and Exams are pretty difficult. He has good notes and explains them well but after a 3 hour lecture, it gets really hard to take in.
neil is a great lecturer, he can somehow make stats fun and interesting.  he teaches really well, so don't miss his classes.  and he's still got his mojo.

Neil's notes are concise, legible, useful, and available for loan. Problem sets are extremely useful, tests and exams are fair and well balanced. Besides that, his in-class manner is funny, refreshing, and makes going to class and learning stats fun!
too much jokes but easy
I like that he has very neat, clean notes, and that they're available for loan.  Very, very funny.  His 3 year old son, whom he adores, is very cute! :)
Great prof...so freakin funny...and cute!..hehe....but the course material is hard..i hate stats
This guy is the bOmb.  Rigourous but still jokes.
really funny.. and hot in that dorky kind of way!
This guy is pure jokes but is also very clear.  A ladys man too.
OMG! This guy can make Math Interesting! Funny too =)
very funny guy
